text: Is there any way to start building the suspense of the decision more into the copy of the emails than you already have? Making it a bit urgent that the reader will need the help of an advisor to make the right decision for themselves? Was just thinking that maybe building your way up to the CTA at the end might satisfy the client more. I definitely think you could benefit from having more direction from the client, though — what’s their idea of needing “more incentive,” since that sounds super subjective? Do they want it to be more salesy, and is that even something your agency would typically do, since you’re not marketers? Could be the clients are just barking up the wrong tree, thinking your agency does something they really don’t….
